org.cleartk.classifier.mallet
Class MalletCRFClassifier

java.lang.Object
  org.cleartk.classifier.Classifier_ImplBase<String,String,List<String>>
      org.cleartk.classifier.mallet.MalletCRFClassifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
Classifier<String>
public class MalletCRFClassifier
extends Classifier_ImplBase<String,String,List<String>>


Copyright (c) 2007-2008, Regents of the University of Colorado
All rights reserved.

Author:
Philip Ogren This classifier provides an interface to the Mallet Conditional Random Field (CRF) tagger. Annotators that use a sequential learner such as this one will need to support classification of a sequence of instances. There are two main considerations that need to be addressed. The first is that the annotator should call this classifier with a sequence of "instances" (i.e. lists of features, one list of features per instance). For example, all the tokens in a sentence could be classified for pos tags or named entity chunk tags - rather than passing in one token at a time. The other consideration is has to do with creating the training data which is discussed in the MalletCRFDataWriter.consume(org.cleartk.classifier.Instance).

classify

public String classify(List<Feature> features)
                throws UnsupportedOperationException
This method simply throws an UnsupportedOperationException because CRF is a sequential classifier.

classifySequence

public List<String> classifySequence(List<List<Feature>> features)
This method classifies several instances at once

Specified by:
classifySequence in interface Classifier<String>
Overrides:
classifySequence in class Classifier_ImplBase<String,String,List<String>>
Parameters:
features - a list of lists of features - each list in the list represents one instance to be classified. The list should correspond to some logical sequence of instances to be classified (e.g. tokens in a sentence or lines in a document) that corresponds to the model that has been built for this classifier.
Returns:
a list of values corresponding to the classifications made.
See Also:
classify(List)

toStrings

private String[][] toStrings(List<List<Feature>> features)
Converts the features into a 2D string array that Mallet can use. The only thing mildly tricky about this method is that the length of each string array is one more than the size of each feature list - i.e. returnValues[0].length == features.get(0).size() + 1 where the last element in each string array is an empty string.

Parameters:
features - the features to be converted.
Returns:
a 2D string array that Mallet can use.
